text:
I was surprised Max stopped taking his medication without consulting Dr. Kwon. Vyvanse can impact appetite, weight, and heart health. Stopping
suddenly might contribute to afib. We should follow any Dr's recommendations and involve them in any decisions about Max’s treatment.
Let’s work together to keep Max on track and healthy.
Message 3728 of 4024
<<Consolidating threads so we don't fork. I've seen those used with nefarious intent recently>>
Thanks you. I’m glad to hear that Max is physically okay after last night’s scare. I am concerned about the mental aspect, especially the screaming
"Robert stay away" into the phone. That isn’t normal, and we should consider accelerating therapy as he is getting worse.
Regarding his medication, as you know, Dr. Kwon involves me in discussions about Max’s Vyvanse—his dosage, diet, and overall health. Last time,
we agreed to reduce his dosage to 30mg and emphasized the importance of taking it daily, especially since he lost 10 pounds.
I was surprised Max stopped taking his medication without consulting Dr. Kwon. Vyvanse can impact appetite, weight, and heart health. Stopping
suddenly might contribute to afib. We should follow any Dr's recommendations and involve them in any decisions about Max’s treatment.
Let’s work together to keep Max on track and healthy.
Sent:08/16/2024 at 08:52 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: Never)
Subject:Re: Max
Message 3729 of 4024
I’d love to get an update when you have a moment. I realize it’s your work day so will be patient of course.
Last night was rough. And we were doing so well. Let me know if you want to try  somehow.
Sent:08/16/2024 at 01:47 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 08/16/2024 at 02:28 PM)
Subject:Re: Max
Message 3730 of 4024
This feels threatening give that first sentence in parentheses unless you are saying you were the one with nefarious intent.
When you open with that what is your expectation for response?
These communications feel like a trap as anything I say feels like a “gotcha” moment.
Max may have thoughts on who is involved in managing his healthcare and as I understand has a right to privacy now.
He is doing well.
Sent:08/16/2024 at 02:37 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 08/16/2024 at 02:39 PM)
Subject:Re: Max
